discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
ACID-compliant transactions ensure that data operations are Atomic, Consistent, Isolated, and Durable. This greatly enhances data reliability, consistency, and quality compared to traditional data lakes, which typically lack strong transactional guarantees.

choices.C: A data lakehouse provides storage solutions for structured and unstructured data.
choices.B: A data lakehouse allows the use of SQL queries to examine data.
choices.A: A data lakehouse stores data in open formats.
choices.D: A data lakehouse supports ACID-compliant transactions.

questions.question_text: Which data lakehouse feature results in improved data quality over a traditional data lake?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Cluster pools help in reducing the start-up time of clusters by maintaining a set of idle, ready-to-use instances. This allows jobs, such as automated reports, to start faster, ensuring that the report is refreshed as quickly as possible.
This question is repeated, a cluster pool helps to reduce the times of cold start and change the scaling .

choices.C: An automated report needs to be refreshed as quickly as possible.
choices.B: An automated report needs to be runnable by all stakeholders.
choices.D: An automated report needs to be made reproducible.
choices.A: An automated report needs to be version-controlled across multiple collaborators.

questions.question_text: In which scenario will a data team want to utilize cluster pools?
What is hosted completely in the control plane of the classic Databricks architecture?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The databricks web application is the only one that is completely hosted in the control plane. The others are hosted in the data plane.

Selected Answer: B
The Databricks web application, which includes the UI, job management, and other control functionalities, is hosted entirely in the control plane. The other components, such as worker nodes, driver nodes, and the Databricks Filesystem, are part of the data plane, which runs in the customer's cloud account.

Selected Answer: D
Databricks Repos integrates with Git, allowing users to work with multiple branches. This enables collaborative development, feature branching, and version control, making it superior to the built-in Databricks Notebooks versioning, which only tracks notebook history without Git-based workflows.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

choices.B: Databricks Repos is wholly housed within the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform
choices.C: Databricks Repos provides the ability to comment on specific changes
choices.A: Databricks Repos allows users to revert to previous versions of a notebook
choices.D: Databricks Repos supports the use of multiple branches

questions.question_text:
A data engineer needs to determine whether to use the built-in Databricks Notebooks versioning or version their project using Databricks Repos.

What is an advantage of using Databricks Repos over the Databricks Notebooks versioning?
What is a benefit of the Databricks Lakehouse Architecture embracing open source technologies?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is Correct

Selected Answer: A
By using open-source technologies, Databricks allows organizations to avoid being tied to a single vendor's ecosystem, offering flexibility and interoperability across different platforms and tools.
